Text saved: "The Life of Pi" is a very special story. It is about a teenage boy from India. His name is Pi. His ship sinks in the Pacific Ocean. He is on a small boat with a dangerous tiger. The Canadian writer Yann Martel wrote the book. It is his third book. The book came out in 2001. It sold more than seven million copies all over the world. It also won many prizes. People can read it in 41 different languages. Martel's father was a diplomat. A diplomat is a person who works for their country in other countries. When Martel was a child, he lived in Costa Rica, Canada, France and Mexico.
